data.name: Conway's Noise
data.description:
Conway's game of life can be used to generate noise! This is a type of noise that, with the same inputs, will generate the same output, but will still seem random. Useful, for example, in creating game maps just from a seed.
Given a 2d array as your input, output the nth generation of a modified game of life.
The rules of the game are: Each cell's neighborhood is the 8 cells immediately around it (see: Moore Neighbourhood) 
  1. Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  2. Any live cell that doesn't, dies.
  3. Any dead cell with exactly 3 live neighbours comes to life.
Unlike the normal game, our version has one additional rule:
  4. Any dead cell with exactly 2 live neighbours also comes to life.
A dead cell is represented as an integer of the amount of live neigbours it has.
A live cell is represented the same way, but with a '1' infront. ( f. ex.: 13 - alive with 3 neighbors)


The 2d array can be represented in html using the preloaded functions 'draw()' or 'draw_debug()'

- Expand the array to the size given, with 'size' denoting the additional rows in all four directions. - Update the neigbours of each cell - Update who lives and dies - Return the final map as an array.


IMPORTANT: return the final array without updated neighbors! This provides a better noise result. example: 
starterMap = [[12, 14, 13],
              [ 5,  6, 14],
              [12, 13,  3]]
              
=> draw(starterMap)
┌─────────┐
│░░░░░░░░░│         -> ░░░ means the cell is alive
│▓▓▓███░░░│            other shades represent the how many neighbours the dead cell has.
│░░░░░░▒▒▒│
└─────────┘

=> map = expand(starterMap, 1)
=> draw(map)
┌───────────────┐
│               │
│   ░░░░░░░░░   │
│   ▓▓▓███░░░   │
│   ░░░░░░▒▒▒   │
│               │
└───────────────┘

=> iterate(map)
=> draw(map)
┌───────────────┐
│▒▒▒░░░░░░░░░▒▒▒│
│▒▒▒▒▒▒░░░░░░░░░│
│░░░▓▓▓███░░░░░░│
│▒▒▒▒▒▒░░░░░░▒▒▒│
│▒▒▒░░░░░░▒▒▒   │
└───────────────┘

(Don't do this for the final step)
=> update_weights(map)
=> draw(map)
┌───────────────┐
│▒▒▒░░░░░░░░░▒▒▒│
│▒▒▒▓▓▓░░░░░░░░░│
│░░░▒▒▒▓▓▓░░░░░░│
│▒▒▒▓▓▓░░░░░░▒▒▒│
│▒▒▒░░░░░░▒▒▒▒▒▒│
└───────────────┘
